ResearchProjectDef.label: Low-power Nexus connection
ResearchProjectDef.description: Establish a primitive connection to the Nexus. The primitiveness of this connection means the information we can transmit and recieve is limited. More advanced technologies will need something better...

ResearchProjectDef.label: Molecular lathing
ResearchProjectDef.description: Using extreme temperatures and nanotechnology, we can restructure materials at a molecular level.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Ferrogel production
ResearchProjectDef.description: Ferrogel is a component in many Illuminate structures and weapons, and is highly versatile. It is of utmost important we have a nanolathe configuration to produce it.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Carbon Extraction
ResearchProjectDef.description: Our nanolathes should be able to extract carbon from given resources for future processing. Carbon is used in multiple crafting recipes, but ultimately does very little by itself.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tungsten Processing
ResearchProjectDef.description: Tungsten is a vital resource for many Illuminate technologies, however it is next to useless in it's raw form. We can configure our nanolathes to process raw tungsten into a more usable form.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Aero-tungsten Carbide Forging
ResearchProjectDef.description: Using our nanolathes, we can forge tungsten, ferrogel, and carbon into a high-durability metal.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Nanotechnology
ResearchProjectDef.description: Aerotungsten's unique properties can be exploited to create flexible computers on a molecular scale.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Molecular weaving
ResearchProjectDef.description: We can apply the processes used in looms on a molecular scale to create more resistant fabric-like materials

ResearchProjectDef.label: Nanofibers
ResearchProjectDef.description: By using our newly designed nanoloom, we can start to weave materials on a molecular level. This fiber is a perfect way to test our nanoloom, and make sure all functions work as intended. It is also somewhat better than normal fabric.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Interlocking materials
ResearchProjectDef.description: Now that we have proven our nanoloom to be fully functional, we can start to interweave different types of materials. Carbon and nanofiber should create a particularly resistant fabric.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Ferrogel Insulation
ResearchProjectDef.description: Ferrogel is a particularly good insulation material. By interweaving it with nanofiber, we believe we could create a fabric with similar properties.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Restructured aero-tungsten
ResearchProjectDef.description: We can interlace our fabric with aero-tungsten carbide to gain some of it's high structural stability in fabric. Naturally, it is not quite as strong.
